Submodules

StochasticDFO.trust_region.base_model module

class BaseModel(dim, **options)

Bases: object

Base class for constructing quadratic model for trust-region method. The function value, gradient, and Hessian at a point x are computed on the fly, and stored in attributes value, grad, and hessian, respectively.

dim

Dimension of the space

Type:

Positive integer

options

Model options

Type:

dict; optional

The options are
design_region_radius: float

Initial design region radius

design_region_radius_min: float

Minimum value of design region radius. If the design region radius falls below this value, the algorithm stops.

gamma_0: float

Factor by which the design region radius will be scaled down. This parameter takes values in (0,1).

k_delta: float

Parameter used to check the accuracy of derivatives.

k_sigma: float

Parameter used to check if sample-size is sufficiently large.

abs_tol: float

Absolute tolerance.

rel_tol: float

Relative tolerance.

sample_size: int

The initial sample-size

sample_size_increment: int

The value by which the sample-size will be incremented.

printlevel: int

The level of verbosity of the output. Takes values 1,2, and 3, with 1 being the minimum level of verbosity, and 3 the maximum level of verbosity.

check_design_radius()

Checks that the design region of the model is not too small. To be implemented by the child method.

Returns:

out – Returns True if the design radius is larger than the threshold and False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

fun_val(p)

Returns the actual/estimated value of the true function at point p. To be implemented by the child method.

Parameters:

p (Numpy array) – Point

Returns:

out – Actual/estimated value of true function at p

Return type:

float

increase_grad_accuracy(d)

Checks if the model’s derivatives are accurate. To be implemented by the child method.

Parameters:

d (Numpy array) – Model step

Returns:

out – Returns True if the accuracy of the gradients are increased and and False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

increase_sample_accuracy(d, x)

Checks if the current sample size is adequate. To be implemented by the child method.

Parameters:

  • d (Numpy array) – Model step

  • x (Numpy array) – Current iterate

Returns:

out – Returns True if the sample size is increased and and False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

update(x)

Updates the model function value, gradient, and hessian at point x. To be implemented by the child method.

Parameters:

x (Numpy array) – Current iterate

update_sample_size()

Updates the sample size if needed. To be implemented by the child method.

property grad
property hess
property value

StochasticDFO.trust_region.regression_model module

class RegressionModel(dim, so, **options)

Bases: BaseModel

Implementation of BaseModel using second-order regression-based derivatives. The function value, gradient, and Hessian at a point x are computed on the fly, and stored in attributes value, grad, and hessian, respectively.

dim

Dimension of the space

Type:

int

so

Instance of class Stochastic Objective

Type:

StochasticObjective object

options

Model options

Type:

dict; optional

The options are
design_region_radius: float

Initial design region radius

design_region_radius_min: float

Minimum value of design region radius. If the design region radius falls below this value, the algorithm stops.

gamma_0: float

Factor by which the design region radius will be scaled down. This parameter takes values in (0,1).

k_delta: float

Parameter used to check the accuracy of derivatives.

k_sigma: float

Parameter used to check if sample-size is sufficiently large.

abs_tol: float

Absolute tolerance.

rel_tol: float

Relative tolerance.

sample_size: int

The initial sample-size

sample_size_increment: int

The value by which the sample-size will be incremented.

printlevel: int

The level of verbosity of the output. Takes values 1,2, and 3, with 1 being the minimum level of verbosity, and 3 the maximum level of verbosity.

check_design_radius()

Checks that the design region of the model is not too small.

Returns:

out – Returns True if the design radius is larger than the threshold and False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Returns the actual/estimated value of the true function at point p.

Parameters:

p (Numpy array) – Point

Returns:

out – Actual/estimated value of true function at p

Return type:

float

Checks if the model’s derivatives are accurate.

Parameters:

d (Numpy array) – Model step

Returns:

out – Returns True if the accuracy of the gradients are increased and and False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

increase_sample_accuracy(d, x)

Checks if the current sample size is adequate.

Parameters:

  • d (Numpy array) – Model step

  • x (Numpy array) – Current iterate

Returns:

out – Returns True if the sample size is increased and and False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Updates the model function value, gradient, and hessian at point x.

Parameters:

x (Numpy array) – Current iterate

Updates the sample size if needed.

StochasticDFO.trust_region.tr_subproblem module

class TRSubproblem(dim, printlevel=1)

Bases: object

Base class to solve the trust region subproblem. The gradient, Hessian, and trust region radius are stored in the attributes grad, hessian, and trust_region_radius, respectively.

dim

Dimension of the space

Type:

int

printlevel

The level of verbosity of the output. Takes values 1,2, and 3, with 1 being the minimum level of verbosity, and 3 the maximum level of verbosity.

Type:

int; optional

opt_check

If True, calculates the degree of violation of the optimality measure for the trust region subproblem solution.

Type:

bool; optional

minimizer

The minimizer of the subproblem.

Type:

Numpy array

optimality_measure()

Checks for the optimality conditions on the solution returned by the solve method. To be implemented by the child method.

Returns:

out – The maximum violation of the optimality measure

Return type:

float

solve(grad, hess, trust_region_radius)

Solves the trust region subproblem. To be implemented by the child method.

Parameters:

  • grad (Numpy array) – Gradient

  • hess (Numpy array) – Hessian matrix

  • trust_region_radius (float) – The maximum allowable value of the trust region step

property grad
property hess
property trust_region_radius

StochasticDFO.trust_region.tr_subproblem_exact module

class TRSubproblemExact(dim, kappa_easy=0.1, kappa_hard=0.1, tol=1e-14, printlevel=1, opt_check=False)

Bases: TRSubproblem

Class to solve the trust region subproblem exactly. The gradient, Hessian, and trust region radius are stored in the attributes grad, hessian, and trust_region_radius, respectively.

dim

Dimension of the space

Type:

int

kappa_easy

Parameter used to determine the stopping criteria for the easy case in the trust region subproblem.

Type:

float; optional

kappa_hard

Parameter used to determine the stopping criteria for the hard case in the trust region subproblem.

Type:

float; optional

tol

Tolerance parameter.

Type:

float; optional

printlevel

The level of verbosity of the output. Takes values 1,2, and 3, with 1 being the minimum level of verbosity, and 3 the maximum level of verbosity.

Type:

int; optional

opt_check

If True, calculates the degree of violation of the optimality measure for the trust region subproblem solution.

Type:

bool; optional

minimizer

The minimizer of the subproblem.

Type:

Numpy array

multiplier

The dual solution of the trust region subproblem.

Type:

float

optimality_measure()

Checks for the optimality conditions on the solution returned by the solve method.

Returns:

out – The maximum violation of the optimality measure.

Return type:

float

solve(grad, hess, trust_region_radius)

Solves the trust region subproblem.

Parameters:

  • grad (Numpy array) – Gradient

  • hess (Numpy array) – Hessian matrix

  • trust_region_radius (float) – The maximum allowable value of the trust region step

StochasticDFO.trust_region.trust_region module

class RegTR(model, x, **options)

Bases: object

Regression-based trust region

model

Instance of class BaseModel or its child.

Type:

BaseModel object

x

Current iterate.

Type:

Numpy array

options

Trust region solver options.

Type:

dict; optional

dim

Dimension of the space.

Type:

int

iter_counter

Current iteration counter.

Type:

int

rho

Model improvement ratio.

Type:

float

model_minimizer

The minimizer of the model function.

Type:

Numpy array

initial_grad_norm

The norm of initial model gradient

Type:

float

trsubprob

Instance of class TRSubproblem or its child

Type:

TRSubproblem object

The options are
trust_region_radius: float

Initial trust region radius

trust_region_radius_min: float

Minimum value of trust region radius. If the trust region radius falls below this value, the algorithm stops.

trust_region_radius_max: flaot

Maximum value of trust region radius. The algorithm never computes steps larger than this value.

gamma_0: float

Factor by which the trust region radius will be scaled down. This parameter takes values in (0,1).

gamma_1: float

Factor by which the trust region radius will be scaled up. The relationship between gamma_0 and gamma_1 satisfies 0 < gamma_0 < 1 < gamma_1.

eta_0: float

Minimum trust region acceptance for proposed step.

eta_1: float

Maximum trust region acceptance for proposed step. The relationship between eta_0 and eta_1 satisfies 0 < eta_0 < eta_1.

max_iter: int

Maximum number of iterations to perform.

abs_tol: float

Absolute tolerance used to check the convergence of gradient norm.

rel_tol: float

Relative tolerance used to check the convergence of gradient norm.

printlevel: int

The level of verbosity of the output. Takes values 1,2, and 3, with 1 being the minimum level of verbosity, and 3 the maximum level of verbosity.

kappa_easy: float

Parameter used to determine the stopping criteria in the trust region subproblem solver.

kappa_hard: float

Parameter used to determine the stopping criteria in the trust region subproblem solver.

subprob_max_iter: int

Maximum number of iterations to perform in the trust region subproblem solver.

subprob_regularization: float

Regularizer parameter for the trust region subproblem solver.

subprob_opt_check: bool

If True, calculates the degree of violation of the optimality measure for the trust region subproblem solution.

check_convergence()

Checks for termination criteria.

Returns:

out – Return True if the termination criteria is satisfied and False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

compute_rho()

Computes the ratio of actual function reduction to model reduction.

solve()

Solves the trust region problem

update_trust_region()

Updates the current iterate and trust region radius.
